Best practice knowhow for sustainable farming practices

Improve your agricultural performance - Tailormade courses to help you grow more stable and successful!

Want to learn how to grow sustainably and successfully?

Sign up for 6 agricultural courses and themes about sustainable farming management and benefit from explaining videos, demonstrations of real farmers, posters and many more on how to use sustainable practices on your farm!




Best Practice Courses

Composting and
Biomass Management

Composting and biomass management (of crop residues and/or manure) are fundamental for nutrient and water-holding capacity and healthy soil life.

get started
Cover Crops and
Mulch Management

Cover crops and mulch keep your soil covered and therefore keep it moist and fertile. They also reduce erosion and leguminous cover crops feed your soil with extra nitrogen.

get started
Production of Compost
Tea, Beneficial Microbes

The use of Beneficial Microbes and the production of compost starter and compost tea are important practices for a healthy soil life and a good soil fertility.

get started
Erosion and its Control

Soil erosion through wind or water strongly degrades soil fertility and thus the soilâ€™s value. Learn here what one can do about it.

get started
Pests & Diseases
and Biological Control

Pests & Diseases are present in most farms worldwide, but with simple measures and practices one can reduce them significantly.

get started
Crop Rotation and
Conservation Tillage

Monocultures destabilize your yield and leach your soil out. Learn about the right choice of crop rotation and how to till the soil using conservation tillage practices.

get started
